instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00875 No backlight
threads.message:
Clean board, no history, I do have USB activity and image.

With known good LCD connected and new U8400:
PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT 0V not shorted
PP5V_S0_BKLT_D 5V
PP5V_S0_BKLT_A 5V
ISNS_LCDBKLT_N 13V
ISNS_LCDBKLT_P 13V
BKLT_EN_R 0V R8442 OK
EDP_BKLT_EN 0V I think this comes from CPU

threads.title: 820-00875 No backlight
threads.message:
As per schematic note, enable comes from PCH.
If image is present, PCH detected internal LCD correctly and should enable backlight too.
Try PRAM reset 2-3 times.

threads.title: 820-00875 No backlight
threads.message: Right, never mind, there is no image, but I do have USB activity for sure, already tried clean ME bios and same thing.

threads.title: 820-00875 No backlight
threads.message:
Missing image explains backlight problem then; you should get image first.

Do you get steady 3V3/5V_S0SW_LCD?
If yes, DP_INT_HPD must go high too.

threads.title: 820-00875 No backlight
threads.message: EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN should appear at least in the first few seconds (when chimes).

threads.title: 820-00875 No backlight
threads.message: Yes EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN does come up for about 1sec at 3.3V when Mac starts up.

threads.title: 820-00875 No backlight
threads.message: Did you check 3V3/5V_S0SW_LCD at same time?

threads.title: 820-00875 No backlight
threads.message: 3V3/5V_S0SW_LCD comes up for about 1 sec when booting.

threads.title: 820-00875 No backlight
threads.message:
No pulse at DP_INT_HPD at same time?
This denotes a problem with LCD assembly, or video connector.

threads.title: 820-00875 No backlight
threads.message: DP_INT_HPD also pulses 3.3V at boot up, flex and lcd are known good ones.

threads.title: 820-00875 No backlight
threads.message:
Looks like PCH doesn't get DP_INT_HPD signal.
May have bad trace/solder, or internal damage.
